Some of that water was made by Allah to remain in the earth to fill wells and ditches that function in the field of irrigation, and because the water in the earth also comes into contact with layers of metal and other chemicals, the water contains chemical elements that increase soil fertility, and when it passes through the slopes of volcanoes, it can also become sources of hot springs containing sulfur, and can be used as hot spring baths that are very useful for curing skin diseases and so on.

All sources of water usage, if utilized with gratitude to the presence of Allah, will surely be enjoyed, but if humans are greedy and damage it, then indeed Allah is also able to eliminate it, especially if those places are used for acts of disobedience.
text.19:
Then, by means of that rainwater, Allah causes to grow for mankind gardens of dates and grapes, and other fruits of various colors that can be eaten. And from those plants, there are also those that become a source of livelihood, such as the products of pepper trees, nutmeg, cloves, and so on.

And He also created for mankind a type of tree that comes from Mount Sinai, namely the olive tree, which grows abundantly around that mountain, producing a lot of oil and is often used to enhance dishes, and lately can also be used as cosmetic ingredients and medicines because olive oil does not contain cholesterol that is harmful to the body.
text.20:
Then, by means of that rainwater, Allah causes to grow for mankind gardens of dates and grapes, and other fruits of various colors that can be eaten. And from those plants, there are also those that become a source of livelihood, such as the products of pepper trees, nutmeg, cloves, and so on.

And He also created for mankind a type of tree that comes from Mount Sinai, namely the olive tree, which grows abundantly around that mountain, which produces a lot of oil and is often used to enhance dishes, and in recent times can also be used as cosmetic ingredients and medicines because olive oil does not contain cholesterol that is harmful to the body.
text.21:
Indeed, in the creation of livestock, there is truly a very important lesson for humans, in addition to its great benefits as a blessing from Allah. Livestock can be a source of learning and research material, for example, how a cow, whose main food, after being chewed and entering its stomach, its essence then mixes with blood, can produce milk that is very beneficial for the body. From its stomach, Allah then has the power to separate milk from the mixture of two dirty substances, namely blood and cow dung that are in its stomach, as mentioned in Allah's word:

And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers. (an-Nahl/16: 66)

Then Allah describes in another verse the happiness felt by the owner of the cows when releasing his cows to the pasture in the morning. The same happiness is also felt when the livestock return to their pens in the afternoon. Allah's word:

And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them home and when you drive them out [to pasture]. (an-Nahl/16: 6)

If detailed, there are many benefits that humans get from livestock:

1. Milk that is very delicious to drink and contains various elements needed by the body to stay healthy, can also be made into butter, cheese, and others.

2. Its fur or hair can be used as clothing and blankets that are very useful, especially in winter.

3. Its meat can be eaten immediately or preserved in cans.

4. Used as vehicles, especially to go to distant places that are difficult to reach by other vehicles as mentioned in verse 21.

And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty. (an-Nahl/16: 7)
text.22:
On the backs of livestock, especially camels, they can be used as a means of transporting people or goods to very distant places through deserts that are difficult for other vehicles to traverse, in addition to using ships as vehicles at sea.

And (He has created) horses, mules, and donkeys, for you to ride and (as) adornment. And Allah creates what you do not know. (an-Nahl/16: 8)
text.23: This verse explains that Allah sent Noah to his people to warn them about Allah's punishment if they committed shirk (polytheism) with Him and denied His Messenger, saying gently to them, "O my people, worship Allah, the One and Only, do not associate anything with Him, for there is no god for you other than Him. So why do you not fear His punishment and distance yourselves from associating partners with Him?"
text.24:
This gentle call of Prophet Noah was answered with mockery from his people, who claimed that Noah was nothing more than an ordinary human being like them, possessing no superiority, either physically or mentally, that would qualify him to be a messenger of Allah and receive revelation. Noah was accused of only wanting to be in a position higher than them, and wanting more power. To achieve this goal, he claimed to be a messenger of Allah, when in reality he was not worthy. Then they mentioned two things that were the reasons for not acknowledging Noah as a messenger of Allah.

First, if Allah had wanted to send a messenger who commanded worship only to Allah alone, then He would have sent some angels, and not sent an ordinary human being.

Second, they had never heard from their own ancestors what Noah had put forward, about worship only to Allah, the One God. The call to *tauhid* (monotheism) was not in the tradition of their ancestors, so they strongly opposed Prophet Noah's *dakwah* (preaching). This shows that they had been dragged into blind *taklid* (imitation) and misguidance.
text.25:
This verse explains the attitude of the disbelievers due to their view that belittled Noah's position as a messenger. They said that Noah was nothing more than a man with a deranged mind, who spoke carelessly, and what he said was completely unreasonable, so there was no need to pay attention to him. Therefore, they asked their people to be patient until Noah at some point became aware and returned to his normal state and returned to embracing the religion of their ancestors. Their statement showed their denial, even though they knew that Noah was the most intelligent person among them.

Listening to the words of the people of Prophet Noah, who rejected his position as a messenger, it can be said that every messenger should have advantages over his people in terms of morals and miracles. A messenger's position must be higher so that all his guidance will be followed. In addition, a messenger must be authoritative, so that with his authority he can lead his people to the right path, and the messenger is *maksum*, that is, protected from all sins including arrogance. Their statement that the call to *tauhid* had never been received from their ancestors before. However, their statement was not sufficient to be used as a reason to reject Noah's message (*risalah*). Their accusation that Prophet Noah suffered from memory loss contradicted the reality they saw and experienced themselves.
text.26:
After Noah saw the denial of his people who refused to acknowledge their error, even though Noah had carried out his duty of preaching for a long time, Allah revealed to him that his people would never believe. His followers, namely those who already believed, would not increase in number. Noah then prayed to his Lord for help, saying, "My Lord, help me, because they have denied me." Noah's prayer is mentioned in Allah's word:

So he (Noah) called upon his Lord, "Indeed, I am overcome, so help (me)." (al-Qamar/54: 10)

And as in His word:

And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant." (Nuh/71: 26)
text.27:
After Noah's prayer was answered, Allah revealed to him to begin building the ark under His supervision and guidance, so that the ark would be sturdy and not easily damaged, and so that Noah would know the construction techniques, because building a large and sturdy ark certainly required expertise. When Allah's command came to destroy his people with a great flood, and the signs had appeared, namely the *tannur* (oven) for baking bread underground had begun to spout water, then Allah commanded Prophet Noah to put into the ark a pair, male and female, of each type of animal. The ark was made with levels. The lowest level was for wild animals such as lions, tigers, and so on. On the second level were livestock such as: cows, goats, and so on. On the third level were all kinds of birds in pairs, and on the very top level were Prophet Noah and all his family who were saved, including three of his sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth. As for his son named Canaan, he was among those who drowned, because he did not want to go with his father.

With the inclusion of every type of animal that existed at that time, Noah's ark was a complete zoo. All the animals that did not enter the ark and the disbelievers who did not follow Prophet Noah's invitation were drowned in the great flood, in accordance with Allah's threat that they would be afflicted with punishment. Allah had previously forbidden Noah to inform those unjust people of Allah's plan and the purpose of building the ark, because they would all be drowned.
text.28:
Allah commanded Noah, if he and the believers were aboard the ark, to utter praise to Allah as a token of gratitude for the safety of all those on the ark, "All praise is due to Allah, Who has saved us from the wrongdoing people." This verse indicates that we should not rejoice in the descent of punishment upon other people or groups, unless it contains salvation for the believers, their avoidance of the danger of destruction, and the cleansing of the world from all forms of polytheism and disobedience.

According to the explanation of Ibn 'Abbas (ra), besides all kinds of animals, there were 80 people on Noah's ark: Noah along with his three sons and their wives, and 72 believers from Noah's people who were loyal to him.
text.29:
Noah was also commanded to pray, "My Lord, land me at a blessed landing place, as You are the best to accommodate, the One who knows the places that are suitable and harmonious for us." Qatadah said, Allah taught us to recite this prayer when boarding a ship:

And he said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allah is its sailing and its mooring." (Hud/11:41)

And when on a vehicle, to recite:

"Exalted is He who has subjected this to us, and we could not have [otherwise] subdued it. And indeed we, to our Lord, will [surely] return." (az-Zukhruf/43:13-14)
text.30:
Indeed, in the event of the great flood that destroyed the people of Noah who denied His Messenger, by denying the Oneness of Allah and worshipping idols, there is a lesson for the Quraysh who denied the prophethood of Muhammad saw, that the event that befell the people of Noah could also befall the Quraysh who dared to deny the Messenger of Allah and antagonize him. In that event, there were truly some very great punishments for the people of Noah, so that those who came later could learn from it, in accordance with Allah's word:

And We have indeed left it as a sign. Then is there any that will remember? (al-Qamar/54: 15)
text.31: This verse explains that Allah created other peoples after the people of Noah, namely the people of 'Ad, the people of Prophet Hud, the people of Thamud, the people of Prophet Saleh, and the people of Madyan, the people of Prophet Shu'aib. Of these three peoples, the strongest opinion that aligns with this verse is the people of 'Ad, because in the history of prophethood, after Prophet Noah, the next prophet sent was Prophet Hud. Therefore, what is meant by *qarnan akharin* is the people of 'Ad, Thamud, and Madyan.
text.32: This verse explains that Allah sent to the people of 'Ad a messenger from among themselves, namely the Prophet Hud, who carried out da'wah (calling to Islam) to them, proclaiming, "O my people, worship Allah and abandon all your idols, for there is absolutely no God worthy of worship in truth except Him. Why do you not fear Him?"
text.33: The leaders of his people who disbelieved denied the Oneness of Allah, and the existence of resurrection and reckoning on the Day of Judgment because they were excessively fond of the luxuries of life in this world. They responded to the call of Prophet Hud by saying, "This man (Hud) is nothing but a human being like you, possessing no superiority, eating and drinking as we do. Therefore, his call should not be heeded at all."
text.34: The leaders of the disbelievers continued their speech, "If you obey a human being like yourselves, and simply follow Hud's call without prior investigation, surely you will be losers and deceived." They did not want the messenger to be just an ordinary human. They wanted the messenger to be from the angels so that he would appear great and extraordinary. However, if the messenger were an angel, they would certainly not be able to follow him, because the character of angels is not the same as the character of humans. Humans cannot possibly follow the way of worship and the way of life of angels who have no desires, so their lives are always and only for worship. Whereas humans are weak, have desires, and are easily tempted by Iblis and Satan.
text.35:
Then they added to their reasons for denying the messenger sent by Allah, namely the Prophet Hud, by saying how could the Prophet Hud promise his followers that if humans have died, and their bodies have decomposed in the grave and only bones remain, they will be resurrected again in a complete state from their graves to be reckoned on the Day of Judgment. They did not believe it because they only followed their shallow thinking, even though in Surah Yasin Allah has said:

Say, "He will give life to them who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing." (Yasin/36: 79)
text.36: This verse explains that what Prophet Hud said about the resurrection, according to them, was impossible. They were unwilling to move beyond their simplistic thinking to see the reality that there is the power of Allah beyond the power of humans. Allah is the One who created the universe and all of mankind.
text.37:
Then they reinforced their denial with the statement, "The only real life is the life of this world. Some of us live and then die, followed by others in succession, generation after generation, no different from plants, where there are those who cultivate and those who harvest. We will not be resurrected after death."

The disbelievers only view human life as plants and animals that only experience generational changes from time to time, without any development of thought and culture, and without any responsibility for their daily actions.
text.38: They not only denied the resurrection after death, but also hurled accusations at Hud that he was fabricating lies against Allah. They said, "That man has indeed invented a lie against Allah, and we will never believe in him."
text.39: When Hud heard the words of his people, that they would not believe in him at all, he prayed to Allah, "My Lord, help me because they deny me, even though I have exerted every effort to guide them, but they have closed all the doors of guidance, so that I feel despairing of their faith."
text.40: Allah says, "Wait, before long those who deny you will all become those who regret. My punishment will befall them and at that time all regret will be of no use anymore."
text.41: Thus, they were destroyed with a punishment that had no equal, namely being destroyed by water and a thunderous, devastating sound. They were made like the debris of a great flood, utterly useless, so the wrongdoers were annihilated.
text.42:
After the destruction of the people of 'Ad, this verse explains about the people of Thamud, the people of Madyan and Aikah, and the land of Sodom. To the people of Thamud, Allah sent the Prophet Saleh, but the people of Thamud rejected him, even to the point of killing the Prophet Saleh's camel, which was his miracle.

As for the inhabitants of Madyan and Aikah, Allah sent the Prophet Shu'aib. They were also disobedient and rejected the Prophet Shu'aib, and they liked to reduce the weight in trade. The inhabitants of Sodom also denied the Prophet Lut and many of them practiced homosexuality.
text.43: In this verse, Allah affirms that no community can hasten their term or destruction, nor can they delay it. All of this occurs according to the decree of Allah, the Almighty, who governs this universe and all its contents with order, regularity, and smoothness. Therefore, the communities that have perished cannot precede their appointed term, nor can they postpone or delay it, because for every community there has already been a decree in Lauh Mahfuz, regarding how long they will experience life in the world.
text.44: Then Allah sent to those communities His messengers successively in different periods. In each period, there was a messenger of Allah who functioned to convey His message. Thus, they came one after another until the final prophet, namely Prophet Muhammad. Every time a messenger was sent to his community, that community denied him. Because each of those communities denied His messenger, Allah destroyed them successively and Allah made their stories a topic of conversation for people who came later. Their stories are often mentioned, both in daily conversations and in history lessons about communities that had denied their prophets.
text.45:
Allah sent Musa and his brother Harun (as His assistants) to Pharaoh and his people, carrying nine kinds of miracles as mentioned in Surah al-A'raf and clear arguments for their apostleship, so that they would worship only Allah and abandon associating partners with Him, and so that they would not torture the Children of Israel who were in Egypt, and allow them to be taken back by Musa and Harun to the original land of the Prophet Yaqub in Palestine. Musa and Harun came to Pharaoh with a gentle call, as in His saying:

"And speak to him with gentle speech, perhaps he may remember or fear." (Taha/20: 44)
text.46: Moses and Aaron came to Pharaoh and the chiefs of his people with strong reasons and arguments, but they still did not realize, and even behaved arrogantly as was their custom.
text.47:
They said, "Are we fit to believe in two human beings like ourselves? Is it appropriate for us to submit to them, when they are merely servants and helpers who are subservient to us as masters and lords?" They equated the mission of conveying the message of Allah, which is based on sincerity, trust, and honesty, with worldly positions that stem from rank and wealth. This view was also held by the disbelievers of Quraysh, as explained in this verse:

And they (also) said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man (rich and influential) from one of the two cities (Mecca and Taif)?" (az-Zukhruf/43: 31)

They denied the revelation and prophethood of Muhammad (peace be upon him), because according to their way of thinking, the person appointed as a messenger should be rich and influential. They did not know that Allah's choice for prophethood is not based on wealth or rank, but solely on Allah's grace, which has already been determined in the realm of pre-eternity, and its connection to the nobility of character, purity, and honesty, as well as affection for his people.

The prophets, because of their inner purity, are not influenced by the material world. They receive revelation through angels and serve all the interests of their people. They remain connected to their Lord. If the disbelievers find it strange and question why Allah sent His messengers from among mankind, then it is even stranger and more astonishing to question why they make wood and stone, which are made and carved by their own hands, into gods. How true is what is stated in the verse:

For indeed, it is not the eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts. (al-hajj/22: 46)
text.48: Pharaoh and the leaders of his people continued to deny Moses and Aaron. Thus, they were among those who were destroyed by being drowned in the Red Sea.
text.49: Then, after the enemies of Moses and Aaron were drowned (destroyed), Allah explained His favor bestowed upon His messengers, that He had revealed the Book (the Torah) to Moses, which contained the laws of the Sharia, several commands and prohibitions, with the hope that the Children of Israel would be guided to the path that leads to happiness in this world and the hereafter.
text.50:
This verse explains that Allah has made Isa, the son of Maryam, as a sign of Allah's power, capable of creating a human being from a mother alone without a father, and giving the ability to a baby to speak before his time, and granting him miracles, able to heal the blind from birth, resurrect the dead from their graves, create birds from clay that could fly, and so on. The birth of Isa from a mother, namely Maryam, was made proof of Allah's power, because she conceived without being touched by a man. Maryam and her son became a sign of Allah's power for all mankind, as in His word:

And (mention, O Muhammad, the story of) the one who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her (something) of Our spirit, and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds. (al-Anbiya'/21: 91)

Allah explains that Isa and his mother were given a dwelling place and protected on a high plateau in the Palestinian region that had pastures and clear flowing water sources. The Prophet Isa and Maryam never left Palestine or Syria during their lifetime. Some say that the Prophet Isa went to Rabwah near Lahore in Pakistan and died there, but this opinion has no basis whatsoever.
text.51:
Allah commanded the prophets to eat lawful and good sustenance that Allah had bestowed upon them, and they were never allowed to consume unlawful wealth, always to perform good deeds, and to avoid vile and reprehensible acts. The prophets were the first who had to obey Allah's commands, because they would be role models for the people to whom they were sent to convey the message of their Lord. This command, although only directed to the prophets, also applies to their people without exception, because the prophets are role models for their people except in some matters that are specific to the prophets only, because it would not be appropriate if it were also obligatory for their people. Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (saw) said:

"O people, indeed Allah Ta'ala is good, He only accepts what is good. Indeed, Allah Ta'ala commands the believers with what He commanded His Messengers. Then the Messenger of Allah (saw) recited this verse (ya ayyuhar-rusulu kulu minath-thayyibati wa'malu saliha inni bima ta'malu 'alim, "O messengers! Eat of the good things and do righteous deeds. Indeed, I am Knowing of what you do."). Then the Messenger of Allah (saw) recited again the verse ya ayyuhalladzina amanu kulu min thayyibati ma razaqnakum... Then the Prophet explained the condition of a person who had traveled a long journey, his hair was disheveled and full of dust, and his food was from the unlawful, his drink was from the unlawful, and his clothes were also from the unlawful. The person said while raising his hands to the sky, "O my Lord! O my Lord! How is it possible that his prayer will be answered?" (Narrated by Muslim and at-Tirmidzi)

In this verse, Allah prioritizes the command to eat lawful and good food before doing good deeds. This means that good deeds will not be accepted by Allah unless the person who does them eats lawful and good wealth and avoids unlawful wealth. According to a narration received from the Messenger of Allah, he once said:

"Indeed, Allah does not accept the worship of a person who has a morsel of unlawful food in his stomach." And it is narrated authentically that the Prophet (saw) said, "Every flesh that grows from unlawful food, then the fire is more entitled to burn it." (Narrated by Muslim and at-Tirmizi)

In a hadith narrated by Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Mardawaih from Ummi Abdillah, the sister of Shaddad bin Aus (ra):

That Ummi Abdillah sent a jug of milk to the Messenger of Allah when he was about to break his fast. The milk was rejected by the Messenger of Allah and he told the milk bearer to return and ask her where she got the milk from. Ummi Abdillah replied, "That is milk from my own goat." Then the milk was rejected again and Ummi Abdillah's messenger was told again to ask where she got the goat from. Ummi Abdillah replied, "I bought the goat with my own money." Only then did the Messenger of Allah accept the milk. The next day, Ummi Abdillah came to see the Messenger of Allah and asked, "O Messenger of Allah, why did you always reject the milk?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "The messengers are commanded not to eat except what is good and not to do anything except what is good as well." (Narrated by Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Mardawaih)

Such is the command of Allah to His Messengers which must be obeyed by mankind because Allah is All-Knowing of the deeds of mankind, nothing is hidden from Him. He will reward good deeds manifold and evil deeds with a commensurate recompense.
text.52:
In this verse, Allah explains that the religion of the messengers is one religion, namely the religion of *tauhid* which worships Allah, the One and Only, and has no partners. Not a single messenger deviated from this principle. If in a religion there is even the slightest deviation from this principle, then that religion is not the religion brought by a messenger, meaning that religion has been altered by its followers and is no longer original. It is impossible for Allah, the One and Only, to choose and appoint a messenger to bring a religion that contradicts the truth and purity of His Oneness. Although the *sharia* and regulations brought by the prophets and messengers differed according to the time and place in which they were sent, regarding the foundation of *tauhid*, there was not the slightest difference between them. Therefore, Allah reaffirms in this verse that He is the Lord of the Universe, and all people should worship and be pious only to Him, and never associate partners with Him in any way.

The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said, "We prophets are (like) brothers from one father, our religion is one." (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim, and Dawud)
text.53: In this verse, Allah explains that the communities of the messengers deviated from the teachings of their messengers, resulting in division into several groups. Each group considered itself to be the one in the right, while the other groups were wrong. Such is the history of the heavenly religions brought by the prophets and messengers. Initially, these religions remained sacred and pure, not even slightly infiltrated by the foundations of shirk. However, gradually, little by little, the pure understanding of tawhid was infiltrated by other understandings that reeked of shirk or deviated completely from the foundation of tawhid. As a result, people fell into the abyss of error, and some even worshipped humans, animals, and objects such as statues and idols. Nevertheless, we can know the sacredness and purity of a religion if it still adheres firmly to the understanding of tawhid. If there is not even the slightest deviation from the foundation of tawhid in that religion, then that religion must be the original and pure religion. But if there is an understanding within it that deviates from that foundation, then that religion is no longer pure and has been infiltrated by misguided understandings. These misguided understandings are what the polytheists of Mecca adhered to, even though they claimed to be followers of Prophet Ibrahim. They had strayed far from the teachings of Prophet Ibrahim, but they still boasted that their religion was the correct one, even though what they worshipped were inanimate objects that were of no benefit whatsoever and had no power to ward off harm. They vehemently opposed the teachings of tawhid brought by Prophet Muhammad (saw) and threatened to take firm action against anyone who opposed them.
text.54:
In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to leave alone those stubborn people who refuse to accept the truth until the time comes when Allah will punish them, both in this world and in the Hereafter, where they will witness for themselves how terrible and devastating the punishment prepared for them is. As for the punishment in this world, it is the calamity that befell them during the Battle of Badr, where they suffered a great defeat and destruction. A similar command is also found in other verses, such as Allah's saying:

"So allow the disbelievers respite. Give them respite for a little while." (ath-thariq/86: 17)

And His saying:

"Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know." (al-hijr/15: 3)
text.55:
In this verse, Allah explains that the disbelievers have been deceived and deluded by their wealth and children, even though abundant wealth and children are not a sign that Allah is pleased with them. They boast about their wealth and possessions to the Muslims, who at that time were in a state of scarcity, as mentioned in Allah's word:

And they say, "We are more abundant in wealth and children [than you], and we will not be punished." (Saba/34: 35)

In reality, Allah grants abundant sustenance to the disbelievers only to plunge them into the valley of disobedience and wickedness because of their arrogant and haughty attitude towards the teachings brought by Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). With abundant wealth and children, they will become oblivious, as if they are the ones who are right and in power. Whatever they do is their right, even if they trample on the rights of others and oppress the weak. But at some point, Allah will surely punish them, because it is *sunnatullah* that injustice and oppression will not last, but will be destroyed and annihilated. This is affirmed by Allah in His word:

So let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through it in worldly life and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disbelievers. (at-Taubah/9: 55)

And His word:

And let not the disbelievers ever think that [because] We extend their time [of enjoyment] it is good for them. We only extend it for them so that they may increase in sin, and for them is a humiliating punishment. (Ali 'Imran/3: 178)

Qatadah, a *mufassir*, has given his commentary on this verse as follows: "Allah has deceived the disbelievers with their wealth and children. O son of Adam, do not consider someone honorable because of their wealth and children, but honor them because of their faith and good deeds." It is narrated from Ibn Mas'ud that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said:

Indeed, Allah has divided character traits among you just as He has divided sustenance among you. Indeed, Allah gives worldly blessings to those He is pleased with and to those He is not pleased with. And He does not give steadfastness in religion except to those He is pleased with. And whoever Allah gives steadfastness in religion to, it means Allah is pleased with him. By the Lord in whose hand is the soul of Muhammad, a servant's Islam is not complete unless his heart and tongue are also Muslim, and he does not believe until his neighbor feels safe from his evil. The companions asked, "What is his evil, O Messenger of Allah?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "His deception and his injustice." (Narrated by Ahmad)
text.56:
In this verse, Allah explains that the disbelievers have been deceived and deluded by their wealth and children, even though abundant wealth and children are not a sign that Allah is pleased with them. They boast about their wealth and possessions to the Muslims who, at that time, were in a state of scarcity, as mentioned in Allah's words:

And they say, "We are more abundant in wealth and children [than you], and we will not be punished." (Saba/34: 35)

In reality, Allah grants ample sustenance to the disbelievers only to plunge them into the depths of disobedience and wickedness because of their arrogant and haughty attitude towards the teachings brought by Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). With abundant wealth and children, they become oblivious, as if they are the ones who are right and in power. Whatever they do is their right, even if it means trampling on the rights of others and oppressing the weak. But at some point, Allah will surely punish them, because it is *sunnatullah* (Allah's established way) that injustice and oppression will not last, but will be destroyed and annihilated. This is affirmed by Allah in His words:

So let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through it in worldly life and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disbelievers. (at-Taubah/9: 55)

And His words:

And let not the disbelievers ever think that [because] We extend their time [of enjoyment] it is good for them. We only extend it for them so that they may increase in sin, and for them is a humiliating punishment. (Ali 'Imran/3: 178)

Qatadah, a *mufassir* (Quran commentator), has given his commentary on this verse as follows: "Allah has deceived the disbelievers with their wealth and children. O son of Adam, do not consider someone honorable because of their wealth and children, but honor them because of their faith and good deeds." It is narrated from Ibn Mas'ud that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

Indeed, Allah has divided character traits among you just as He has divided sustenance among you. Indeed, Allah gives worldly blessings to those He is pleased with and to those He is not pleased with. And He does not give steadfastness in religion except to those He is pleased with. And whoever Allah gives steadfastness in religion to, it means Allah is pleased with him. By the Lord in whose hand is the soul of Muhammad, a servant's Islam is not complete unless his heart and tongue are also Muslim, and he does not believe until his neighbor feels safe from his evil. The companions asked, "What is his evil, O Messenger of Allah?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "His deception and his injustice." (Narrated by Ahmad)
text.57: One of the characteristics of those who truly believe is, first and foremost, fear of God. Therefore, they always seek His pleasure by diligently performing all His commands and avoiding all His prohibitions. Their lives are guided by religious teachings because those teachings are their principles. Anything that contradicts those principles is rejected by them, regardless of the consequences. Their faith cannot be shaken by any persuasion or threat.
text.58:
The second characteristic is complete belief in the evidence of Allah's Oneness and power, which is widely spread throughout the universe, as Allah states:

"Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the night and the day are signs for those of understanding. Who remember Allah while standing or sitting or [lying] on their sides and give thought to the creation of the heavens and the earth, [saying], "Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire." (Ali 'Imran/3: 190-191)

They also completely believe in all the verses revealed to His Messenger. What is mentioned in those verses is absolute truth that cannot be compromised.
text.59:
The third characteristic is maintaining the purity of *tauhid* by truly worshipping Allah alone without associating partners with Him in worship. Believers will not worship idols or seek help from them, even if those idols are considered by the polytheists as a means to draw closer to Allah, as stated in His word:

"And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give *zakat*. And that is the correct religion." (al-Bayyinah/98: 5)

They will not seek help from graves because they are fully convinced that such an act is the same as seeking help from idols, and it is an act of *shirk* that is greatly despised by Allah. Nor will they seek help from spirits, *jinn*, and devils, because that too is *shirk*. Thus, they avoid all actions that lead to associating partners with Allah as much as possible, so that their belief is truly pure, not contaminated in the slightest by anything that smacks of *shirk*.
text.60:
The fourth characteristic is fear of Allah, because they are certain that they will return to Him on the Day of Reckoning, where all of mankind's deeds will be accounted for. Even though they have carried out all of God's commands and avoided all of His prohibitions, and spent their wealth in the way of Allah, they still fear that their good deeds will not be accepted, because there may be elements of *riya'* (showing off) or other factors that cause the rejection of those deeds. Therefore, they are always motivated to continue doing good, because if the previous deeds are not accepted, perhaps the subsequent deeds will be accepted and rewarded manifold.

In a hadith narrated by Ibn Abi Hatim from 'Aishah, she once asked the Prophet:

Siti Aisyah once asked the Messenger of Allah concerning this verse (alladzina yu'tuna ma ataw waqulubuhum wajilah), whether what is meant by this verse is someone who commits adultery, drinks alcohol, or steals, and because of that, he fears God and His punishment? The Messenger of Allah answered this question, "That is not what is meant, O daughter of Abu Bakar as-shiddiq. What is meant in this verse are those who perform prayer, fast, and spend their wealth, but they fear that their deeds are among those that are not accepted (mardud)." (Narrated by Ahmad and at-Tirmidzi)
text.61:
This verse affirms that those who possess these characteristics are always quick to do good when there is an opportunity and always strive to increase their good deeds. As soon as they finish performing a good deed, they want to immediately do another, and so on. Those who have such characteristics will be rewarded by Allah for their good deeds in this world and in the Hereafter, as was given to Prophet Ibrahim, as mentioned in His word:

"And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous." (an-Nahl/16: 122)

And His word:

"So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the good reward of the Hereafter. And Allah loves the doers of good." (Ali 'Imran/3: 148)
text.62:
With this verse, Allah explains that it is His *sunnah* and decree that He will not burden anyone with an obligation or command except that which they are capable of fulfilling and within the limits of their ability. There is no *sharia* that He has obligated that is difficult for His servants to perform and beyond their capabilities; it is only humans who perceive it as difficult due to their reluctance, or because they are preoccupied with worldly affairs, or because the task prevents them from fulfilling their desires.

In fact, the command, such as prayer (*salat*), is very light and easy for those who are accustomed to performing it; indeed, *salat* can even alleviate the burdens and pressures of life that one suffers if one truly performs it diligently and with *khusyuk*. Muqatil said, "Whoever is unable to perform *salat* standing may perform it sitting, and if they are unable to sit, then even with a gesture is sufficient." Therefore, there is no reason whatsoever for a believer to free themselves from the obligation of *salat*, nor from other obligations, because all obligations are within the limits of their ability. It is only the desires and whims of humans that make these obligations heavy for them. So, a person like this has wronged themselves and will receive a fitting recompense from God for their denial and reluctance. Every violation of Allah's command will be recorded in the book of deeds, as will good deeds, small and large, all recorded in that book, as mentioned in His saying:

(Allah said), "This is Our record which speaks about you with truth. Indeed, We were having recorded all that you used to do." (al-Jatsiyah/45: 29)

And His saying:

And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this record that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one. (al-Kahf/18: 49)

They will be rewarded according to their deeds as recorded in that book, and they will not be wronged in the slightest.
text.63:
In this verse, Allah explains that the hearts of the polytheists have turned away and are heedless of paying attention to the guidance brought by the Qur'an. They do not want to benefit from it, even though that guidance can lead them to happiness in this world and the hereafter. If they were willing to read and pay attention to the Qur'an, their hearts would surely open and see that the teachings of the Qur'an are indeed very useful and everything contained within it is true. They would acknowledge that all human actions will be accounted for before Allah without exception. This is their first mistake, which leads them to other mistakes and causes them to no longer care about noble moral norms, acting as they please without regard for the rights of others. Whatever they want, they seize, even by robbing and oppressing the weak. Therefore, they have also sunk into polytheism, and the eyes of their hearts have become blind, unable to distinguish between what is right and what is wrong, their ears have become deaf, unable to hear the teachings of religion. A hadith narrated by Ibn Masud, the Prophet (saw) said:

....By the One besides whom there is no god, indeed one of you performs the deeds of the people of Paradise until there is only an arm's length between him and Paradise. But he has already been recorded as one of the people of Hell, so he ends his deeds with the deeds of the people of Hell, and thus he enters Hell. And indeed one of you performs the deeds of the people of Hell until there is only an arm's length between him and Hell. But he has already been recorded as one of the people of Paradise, so he ends his deeds with the deeds of the people of Paradise, and thus he enters Paradise." (Narrated by Ahmad)

They consider only what they inherited from their ancestors to be true. According to them, the Qur'an is just tales of the ancients brought by a madman or just the composition of a poet or teachings received by Muhammad from the People of the Book. When clear explanations about the truth of the Qur'an are given to them that cannot be refuted, they say, "We cannot accept it because it contradicts what our ancestors adhered to and believed in," as mentioned in the verse:

"Nay! They say: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we guide ourselves by their footsteps." (az-Zukhruf/43: 22)
text.64:
In this verse, Allah explains that the polytheists and all those who disbelieve and are disobedient will be punished with a severe torment. At the time when they are surrounded by a terrible and frightening torment as a recompense for their disbelief and disobedience, they will cry out for help and deeply regret their bad fate, especially their leaders and wealthy people who once lived in the world with pleasure and full of enjoyment. But no one can help them at that time, because all affairs and decisions are in the hands of Allah. Their regret is of no use anymore because, like the proverb "the rice has become porridge," their mistakes and disobedience can no longer be forgiven. Allah says:

How many generations before them did We destroy, and they cried for help when it was no longer the time for escape. (shad/38:3)
text.65: Allah said to them not to scream for help on that day, because it would be of no use. That day is the day of retribution for what they did in the world before. This is a definite decree from Allah that they must accept, no one can help or free them from the torment, and they cannot escape from it.
text.66:
The following verse explains that when Allah's verses were recited to them in the world by a messenger sent to them, they denied them, mocked and insulted him due to arrogance and pride, even though the guidance and teachings he brought were true and very beneficial for them if they had only paid attention and listened. Allah says:

"That is because, when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; but when partners were associated with Him, you believed. So the decision is with Allah, the Most High, the Grand." (al-Mumin/40: 12)
text.67: This verse explains that they rejected all the teachings brought by the Prophet Muhammad and considered themselves more noble than him because they were rulers, defenders, and guardians of the Baitullah (House of God, i.e., the Kaaba). They believed no one in the world was more noble than them. They gossiped and completely slandered the Prophet saw (peace be upon him) during their leisure time at night. They accused the Prophet of being a sorcerer, a poet, a soothsayer, and so on. Their actions were not right, because Muhammad was a messenger and Allah would expel the disbelievers from the sacred land because of their evil deeds against the Messenger of Allah.
text.68: In this verse, Allah reproaches their impolite and unreasonable actions and words. Do they not pay attention to the verses of the Qur'an, how beautiful and lofty its word structure is, even though they have ample opportunity to observe it? There is no weakness, contradiction, or anything that diminishes its literary value or degrades the understanding contained within the Qur'an. Indeed, the Qur'an contains clear proofs and arguments that cannot be refuted, whether related to the foundations of noble morals or to the sharia and regulations that can bring them to the highest degree if they are willing to practice and obey them. Or do they consider the arrival of Muhammad as a messenger something impossible that has never happened to previous nations, even though they know of the previous messengers and the fate of the nations that denied them, and even see for themselves the remnants of destruction left by those disobedient nations?
text.69: This verse questions whether they do not recognize Muhammad, their messenger, so that they deny him. In fact, they have known Muhammad since childhood, as a person of good character, the most trustworthy among them, and a descendant of the Bani Hasyim whom they respect and revere, so that they themselves gave him the title al-Amin (the most trustworthy). Abu Sufyan, as the head of their delegation to the Roman Emperor, when asked about Muhammad's characteristics, answered that Muhammad came from a noble family, known for the truthfulness of his words and his trustworthiness (amanah).
text.70:
The following explanation states that they considered Muhammad (peace be upon him) to be a madman who was unaware of all his words. In reality, they knew very well that Muhammad was not mad, and acknowledged that he was the most intelligent among them, a wise scholar. They themselves had appointed him as a judge to resolve disputes among them, when they disagreed about who would place the Hajar Aswad in its original place after the Kaaba building was demolished and repaired.

In this verse, Allah affirms that Muhammad is the bearer of truth from his Lord, not as they accuse him. He invites them to abandon various objects of worship and idols and return to the pure religion of monotheism, the religion of their ancestor, Prophet Ibrahim. He is the bearer of a religion that has laws and regulations for the happiness of mankind in this world and the hereafter. But most of them hate the truth that he proclaims, because their hearts have been closed by shirk, sin, and disobedience. Therefore, they turn away from the right path, always take the wrong path, and can no longer understand the truth, even hating it. Indeed, some of them are aware and repentant, acknowledging in their hearts that the religion brought by Muhammad is a true and good religion, but because they fear being ridiculed by their disbelieving people, they do not want to believe, like the Prophet's own uncle, Abu Talib. He once said, "If it were not for fear of being criticized by the leaders of our tribe, we would have truly become his followers in all things."
text.71:
Then Allah explains that if the Qur'an followed the desires of those who deny Allah and His Messenger, who associate partners with Allah and say that He has a son, and justified all sinful and evil deeds, then the world would surely be destroyed, as mentioned in His word:

"Had there been in them [i.e., the heavens and earth] gods besides Allah, both would have been ruined. Exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe." (al-Anbiya'/21: 22)

If the Qur'an permitted injustice, oppression, and abandoning justice, then there would be chaos and great upheaval in society. If the Qur'an permitted the violation of rights, the seizure of property so that the weak become easy prey for the strong, then this world would never be safe and peaceful. This has been proven in their own lives. The Arab society during the Jahiliyyah period was almost destroyed because they had no noble moral norms, no sharia and regulations that they obeyed. They only boasted of wealth and power, so that in order to compete for it, they fell into the abyss of endless disputes and wars.

Allah again explains that He has bestowed upon them something that should be a source of pride for them, namely the Qur'an. Why do they turn away from it, reject it, despise it, and mock it? If they were aware and conscious, they would not act like that. In fact, it was later proven that the Qur'an made them a noble nation, and they were proud because the Qur'an was first revealed to them and used their language, in accordance with Allah's word:

"And indeed, it is a reminder for you and your people, and you will [all] be questioned." (az-Zukhruf/43: 44)
text.72:
In this verse, Allah questions why they are unwilling to accept the teachings of the Qur'an, even though the Prophet Muhammad never asked them for any reward for conveying the teachings of the Qur'an. The Prophet Muhammad realized that conveying the message was an obligation that had to be carried out in the best possible way upon the command of his Lord. If there was anything he hoped for, it was nothing other than the pleasure of Allah, with which he would be happy, and with that pleasure of Allah, he would receive a reward of grace that would never cease, as mentioned in His word:

Say, "Whatever reward I have asked of you - it is for yourselves. My reward is only from Allah, and He is Witness over all things." (Saba'/34: 47)
text.73: Then, in this verse, Allah assures Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that he is indeed a messenger calling his people to the straight path that leads them to happiness in this world and the hereafter. Allah urges Muhammad not to be influenced by the words of the disbelievers who insult and mock him. All their utterances are mere lies that come out of their mouths due to envy and resentment.
text.74: In this verse, Allah affirms that those who are unwilling to believe and do not believe in the Hereafter have truly deviated from the right path. They have been given various clear reasons and parables. If they were willing to listen and reflect upon them, they would surely realize and return to the truth. But their hearts and minds have been covered by arrogance, disobedience, and the sinful deeds they constantly commit. They have no right whatsoever to Allah's mercy and compassion because all good deeds are of no use at all for people of such a nature.
text.75:
This verse states that even if Allah bestows mercy upon them and removes the dangers that threaten them, they still will not be grateful for that mercy. Instead, they will increase in disobedience and continue to commit sins and injustices. No good can be expected from them. In fact, as explained in the Qur'an, in the Hereafter, after witnessing the severity of the punishment that will be inflicted upon them, and even if their request to be returned to the world to correct their mistakes is granted, they will still commit sins and remain disbelievers and disobedient. Allah says in another verse:

"If you could only see when they are made to stand before the Fire! They will say, “Oh, if only we could be sent back! We would not deny the signs of our Lord, and we would be among the believers.” But what they used to conceal before will become clear to them. And if they were sent back, they would certainly revert to what they were forbidden. Indeed, they are liars." (al-An'am/6: 27-28)
text.76:
Allah inflicted punishment upon them at the Battle of Badr, resulting in the death of many of their leaders and dignitaries, yet they never submitted to Allah nor did they ever obediently follow His teachings and commands. They never humbled themselves before Him, but remained arrogant and haughty, and never ceased committing injustice and sinful deeds. They became increasingly misguided and more actively fought against the religion of Allah, to the point that they prepared more and larger armies and war equipment to fight against the Messenger of Allah. Allah says:

"Then why, when Our punishment came to them, did they not humble themselves? But their hearts became hardened, and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing." (al-Anam/6:43)
text.77:
Indeed, those who have strayed far from the right path will not realize and repent except when the Day of Judgment comes, and the gates of severe torment are opened for them. At that time, they will regret and hope for forgiveness from Allah, but that will not be the time for repentance. Their regret will be of no use, and their repentance will not be accepted. They will surely be plunged into hell as a reward for their denial and disobedience in the world, as stated in Allah's word:

"That was because you rejoiced on earth without right and because you were ever exultant. Enter the gates of Hell, to abide therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant." (al-Mu'min/40: 75-76)
text.78:
This verse explains that Allah has bestowed upon mankind hearing, sight, and a conscience. If mankind would only pay attention to and reflect upon these gifts of Allah, they would surely acknowledge the greatness of Allah's wondrous blessings, and how meticulous and subtle His creation is. The ear, which appears so simple in form, can capture various different sounds. The sounds of animals, birds, sounds that occur in the surrounding nature such as the sound of the roaring wind, the sound of thunder rumbling, and a variety of sounds produced by human civilization such as the sound of vehicles and machines, the sound of flowing music, and melodious sounds. The ear can distinguish these sounds one by one so that humans can determine their attitude towards what they hear. The eye can capture light and the shape of something, can distinguish various colors, can see the beauty of nature, can investigate what is beneficial and what is dangerous. Then the heart, which can feel and appreciate various kinds of feelings, examine every event, and draw conclusions from it to determine an attitude towards it. If humans truly use these three blessings in the best possible way, they will certainly gain many benefits and eventually come to the conclusion that the giver of these blessings and gifts is Vast in His knowledge, Almighty over all things, He is worthy of praise and gratitude for all His gifts. But it turns out that very few people reach that level. As Allah says:

And We had certainly established them in ways We have not established you, and We made for them hearing and vision and hearts. But their hearing and vision and hearts availed them not since they were ever denying the signs of Allah, and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule. (al-Ahqaf/46: 26)

Allah explains to the Prophet Muhammad the attitude of most people who do not want to be grateful to Him, as mentioned in His word:

And most of the people, although you strive [for it], are not believers. (Yusuf/12:103)
text.79:
Among Allah's blessings to mankind is that He created man perfectly, equipped with hearing, sight, and the eye of the heart, and other potentials so that he can utilize all that Allah created on earth and in the heavens, which Allah indeed created for mankind, as mentioned in His word:

"It is He who created for you all that is on earth." (al-Baqarah/2: 29)

And His word:

"Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and has lavished upon you His favors, both seen and unseen?" (Luqman/31: 20)

He created man complete with senses, potentials, tendencies, and conscience so that he can truly be a *khalifah* on earth. There is no creature on this earth whose creation is more perfect than man's, as mentioned in His word:

"We have certainly created man in the best of stature." (at-Tin/95: 4)

With that privilege, man must be grateful to his Creator by utilizing His blessings in the best way possible, doing good deeds and working for the benefit of this world and the hereafter. Because later, Allah will gather all of mankind in the *padang Mahsyar* to receive the reckoning of their deeds during their life in this world.
text.80:
Among Allah's blessings are giving life and causing death. Humans would not be able to enjoy worldly life if Allah did not bestow the spirit (roh) upon them. Only with the spirit within their body can humans strive, endeavor, and think to achieve what they desire and aspire to. No one knows the secret of life and death except Allah. For centuries, even millennia, humans have tried to discover the secret of the spirit so that they can live forever, but until now, no scientist has been able to uncover that secret. Because the matter of the spirit is a hidden secret (ghaib) known only to Allah, as mentioned in His word:

"And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the spirit. Say, "The spirit is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind have not been given of knowledge except a little." (al-Isra'/17: 85)

Furthermore, He is the One who causes the alternation between night and day. Night is made a time for rest, and day is made a time for striving and working. One can imagine what this world would be like if there were only day, and vice versa. Perhaps this world and all the creatures on it would die burned because they are constantly struck by the scorching sun, or perhaps this world would die with all its contents if there were only night all the time, because there is no sun that is a source of energy and the cause of life for creatures in this world. Allah rebukes the attitude and actions of humans who do not want to remember how great His blessings are upon them. Why do they not think about and pay attention to it, so that they are grateful and thankful to Him for all His favors and blessings?
text.81:
In this verse, Allah explains the denial of the disbelievers of Mecca, so that they repeat what was said by the disbelievers of the past, as if their eyes were blind, their ears were deaf, and their hearts were locked shut to paying attention to and contemplating the arguments presented by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), which they could no longer refute. They said that the Day of Resurrection was merely nonsense that was always fabricated by the Prophet Muhammad and the previous messengers. Since ancient times, there have been prophets and messengers who uttered words like those uttered by Muhammad, but in reality, such a long time has passed and the Day of Judgment and the Day of Resurrection have not yet come.

Allah describes the words of their ancestors about the Day of Resurrection with His saying:

"Indeed, this has already been promised to us and to our forefathers before. This is nothing but legends of the former peoples!" (al-Mu'minun/23: 83)
text.82: In this verse, Allah explains how they repeat the words of their ancestors from the past. If they are already dead and their bones have crumbled into dust, will they be resurrected again? According to them, this is an impossible and improbable thing to happen, because until now none of their ancestors who have died and become dust have been able to come back to life. Their words are very wrong.
text.83:
This verse explains how the disbelievers insult and mock Muhammad by saying that they have been given promises that have no truth whatsoever, just like their ancestors were promised similar things to Muhammad's promises, but none of the promises of the previous messengers have been proven. How can they believe and simply accept the words of this madman Muhammad, which have no proof whatsoever and are perhaps just ancient fables? In other verses, there are explanations regarding their statements along with rebuttals and rejections of those statements, such as Allah's words:

"(The disbelievers) say, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state? Even when we are crumbled bones?" They say, "That would then be a losing return." It will only be a single blast, and at once they will be upon the earth, awakened." (an-Nazi'at/79: 10-14)

And His words:

"And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?" Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing." (Yasin/36: 78-79)

And His words:

"Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth? How far, how far is that which you are promised. There is not but our worldly life; we die and live, and we will not be resurrected. He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allah, and we will not believe him." (al-Mu'minun/23: 35-38)
text.84: In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to ask the disbelievers who say that it is impossible for Allah to resurrect those who have died, even though their bones have crumbled into dust, and that it is impossible for Him to gather them in the Plain of Mahsyar later. Who owns the earth and everything on it? The disbelievers are asked to answer this question. Basically, they will answer that the owner and the one in control of it is Allah, because that is the belief of their ancestors. However, they have strayed far from the pure religion of *tauhid* (monotheism) and their *aqidah* (creed) has been tainted by incorrect and misleading beliefs. Therefore, Allah poses this question to them as if they do not know it at all or have forgotten it.
text.85: In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to ask the disbelievers who say that it is impossible for Allah to resurrect those who have died, whose bones have crumbled into dust, and that He cannot gather them in the Plain of Gathering (Mahsyar) later: "To whom belongs the earth and everything on it?" The disbelievers are asked to answer this question. Basically, they will answer that the owner and the one who has power over it is Allah, because that is the belief of their ancestors. However, they have deviated far from the pure religion of monotheism (tauhid), and their creed has been tainted by incorrect and misleading beliefs. Therefore, Allah poses this question to them as if they do not know it at all or have forgotten it.
text.86:
Then Allah also commanded Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to ask them again, who created the seven heavens and who created the mighty 'Arsh (Throne) whose greatness encompasses the heavens and the earth, as mentioned in His saying:

"His Kursi (Footstool) extends over the heavens and the earth." (al-Baqarah/2: 255)

Who regulates and manages them so that everything runs according to such precise and good rules. Allah directly provides the answer to this question because the answer of these disbelievers would certainly be the same, namely that the Creator of all that is Allah, Who possesses and controls it. There would be no other answer from them besides that, because that is fundamentally their belief. It's just that, besides acknowledging Allah's power, they also worship objects of worship such as idols and so on. Then Allah commanded Prophet Muhammad to say to them, "If it is true that Allah created the seven heavens and created the magnificent 'Arsh, and Allah is the One who regulates and manages them, why do you not fear Him and refuse to follow His teachings and commands? Why do you still worship idols, while worshiping other than Allah is greatly despised by Him?"
text.87:
Then Allah also commanded Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to ask them again, who created the seven heavens and who created the mighty 'Arsh (Throne) whose greatness encompasses the heavens and the earth, as mentioned in His saying:

"His Kursi (Footstool) extends over the heavens and the earth." (al-Baqarah/2: 255)

Who regulates and manages them so that everything runs according to such precise and good rules. Allah directly established the answer to this question because surely the answer of these disbelievers would be the same, that the creator of all that is Allah, who owns and controls it. There would be no other answer from them besides that because that is fundamentally their belief. It is only that, besides acknowledging the power of Allah, they also worship objects of worship such as idols and so on. Then Allah commanded Prophet Muhammad to say to them, "If it is true that Allah created the seven heavens and created the magnificent 'Arsh, and Allah is the One who regulates and manages them, why do you not fear Him and do not want to follow His teachings and commands? Why do you still worship idols, while worshiping other than Allah is greatly despised by Him?"
text.88: Then Allah commanded Prophet Muhammad to also ask them, who is it that controls everything and manages it? In whose hand lies absolute power. If Allah protects someone, no power whatsoever can inflict disaster upon them or destroy them. Conversely, if He intends to inflict harm upon someone, no force whatsoever can protect that person. Who possesses such attributes, the All-Powerful, the All-Mighty? The Messenger asked the disbelievers to answer these questions if they truly knew.
text.89: They will surely answer that such attributes belong to Allah alone. Therefore, Allah confirms that they will answer in that way and commands the Prophet to ask them again. If they know that Allah is the All-Powerful and All-Mighty, why are they so deceived and turn away from the religion of Tawhid, constantly opposing Allah and being disobedient to Him? By worshipping idols or other things, it is as if they have been bewitched and their minds can no longer believe, so that their faith becomes chaotic, mixing the truth with falsehood, so that they associate partners with Allah. Whereas Allah will not justify their actions, but is very angry.
text.90: In this verse, Allah affirms to the disbelievers that because all the questions posed to them regarding Allah as the Creator, Owner, and Regulator of everything were answered by them with correct and positive responses, the Qur'an revealed to the Prophet Muhammad to correct and straighten their misguided creed is true. The accusations they made against Muhammad and the Qur'an he brought are false and lies. The Qur'an is not the tales of the ancients, but truly a revelation and guidance from Allah, the All-Creator, the All-Powerful, and the One Who Regulates everything, both on earth and in the heavens, with His wisdom and knowledge.
text.91:
This verse refutes the claims of the polytheists that the angels are daughters of Allah by explaining that Allah never has children, because He is All-Rich, All-Powerful, and Eternal, not needing offspring like humans do. Humans indeed need children to continue their lineage, and when they are old and powerless, their children will help and assist them. And when they die, their children will continue their efforts and professions and elevate their name in their community. Allah, the All-Powerful, All-Rich, and Eternal, does not need all of that.

Allah is not afflicted by fatigue because He is All-Strong, He will not be afflicted by death because He is Eternal, He will not be afflicted by poverty because He is All-Rich, to Him belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. How foolish are the polytheists who equate Allah with humans who are very weak and poor, or if they are not foolish then they are great liars because what they say is completely contrary to the thinking of rational people.

Truly, how weak is the thinking of those who say that Allah has a child or has partners. Glory be to Allah from all such unreasonable assumptions and accusations.
text.92:
This verse explains that Allah, the All-Knowing of all that is unseen (ghaib) which cannot be seen and felt with the five senses, is All-Knowing of all that is visible and manifest and can be seen and felt. Whatever happens in this universe, whether in the heavens or on earth, all happens with His knowledge. Nothing is too big or too small except that it is within His vast knowledge, as mentioned in His word:

"And you (O Muhammad) are not [engaged] in any matter or recite any of the Qur'an and you [people] do not do any deed except that We are witness over you when you are involved in it. And not absent from your Lord is an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven. And not [is there] smaller than that or greater but that it is in a clear register (Lauh Mahfuz)." (Yunus/10: 61)

Such is the vastness and comprehensiveness of Allah's knowledge. Glory be to Allah from all the accusations of the disbelievers who say that He has a son and partners.
text.93:
In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to pray to Him to be kept away from the oppressive disbelievers when He intends to punish them, not to be destroyed along with them, to be saved from His torment and wrath, and to make him among those who are pleased with. This command to pray in this way is taught by Allah because calamities and disasters that Allah inflicts upon the rebellious and oppressive sometimes also befall the innocent, because they live together in a society or a country. This is in accordance with Allah's word:

And fear a trial which will not strike those who oppress [among you] exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in penalty.

(al-Anfal/8: 25)

According to the narration of Imam Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi, the Prophet Muhammad's prayer in this regard was:

Allah) if You intend to inflict punishment upon a people (who are oppressive), then take me in death while I am not being punished along with them. (Riwayat Ahmad dan at-Tirmidzi)
text.94:
In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to pray to Him to be kept away from the oppressive disbelievers if He intends to punish them, not to be destroyed along with them, to be saved from His torment and wrath, and to make him among those who are pleased with. This command to pray in this way is taught by Allah because the calamities and disasters that Allah inflicts upon the rebellious and oppressive sometimes also befall the innocent, because they live together in a society or a country. This is in accordance with Allah's word:

And fear a trial which will not strike those who have wronged among you exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in penalty.

(al-Anfal/8: 25)

According to the narration of Imam Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi, the Prophet Muhammad's prayer in this regard is:

Allah) if You intend to inflict punishment upon a people (who are oppressive), then cause me to die in a state where I am not punished along with them. (Riwayat Ahmad dan at-Tirmidzi)
text.95: Allah explained to the Prophet Muhammad that He is Able to show him the punishment that will be inflicted upon the disbelievers, so that the Prophet Muhammad could see for himself how terrible and severe Allah's punishment is. However, because of His mercy and compassion for the ummah of Muhammad, Allah did not immediately inflict that punishment (in this world), but it has been His decree that the punishment will befall them in the Hereafter, because perhaps later some of them or their descendants will become aware and believe in Allah and His Messenger. Therefore, the Prophet Muhammad should not be too saddened by the actions and treatment of the disbelievers towards him and the Muslims who are indeed in a weak and helpless state.
text.96:
Then Allah gave guidance to the Prophet Muhammad on how best to deal with the attitude of the polytheists. Among them, the Prophet must remain gentle towards them and never retaliate evil with evil, violence with violence, because it was not yet the time to act that way. If they mocked and insulted, the Prophet should forgive their inappropriate words, because those words did not hit their target, but should be answered with words containing guidance and teachings by presenting arguments and reasonable reasons. If they intended to commit acts of persecution, avoid them and stay away as much as possible from opportunities that lead to such actions, and face them with patience and perseverance. The Prophet was also ordered to show them that he was indeed a knight who had no intention whatsoever of harming them. With gentleness and wisdom, they would not run rampant against the Muslims. Gradually, those who were as hard as stone would become soft and realize the mistakes they had made. The Prophet was also asked to believe in his heart that Allah knows all their words and actions. Allah knows better what they do and what is hidden in their hearts.

In accordance with this guidance, Allah says in another verse:

And not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel (evil) with that [deed] which is better; and thereupon the one whom between you and him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend. (Fussilat/41: 34)

Anas bin Malik said, commenting on this verse, "A man said unpleasant things to his brother." So he replied, "If your words are false, then I ask Allah to forgive your lies. If your words are true, then I ask Allah to forgive me."
text.97:
In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to always seek refuge in Him from the whispers of Satan and from his temptations, and so that Satan is always far from him and cannot enter his heart to deceive him.

Such should be the attitude of every fighter for upholding the truth. They must truly guard themselves so as not to be influenced by their desires even once and be driven to commit actions that are untrue and dishonest. Satan very easily plunges humans into the abyss of error, humiliation, and evil when he can enter human desires. Therefore, we should always seek refuge in Allah from the deception of Satan. Indeed, when a person has truly surrendered himself to his Lord in all his actions and always seeks His protection from the deception and temptations of Satan, he becomes pure and his conscience will be touched to always do good and avoid evil. The Messenger of Allah always sought refuge in his Lord so that he would be kept away from the interference of Satan in all his actions, especially in prayer when reciting the Qur'an and at the time of his death.

Narrated by Ahmad, Abu Daud, and at-Tirmidzi and deemed authentic by al-Baihaqi from 'Amr bin Syu'aib and his father from his grandfather, he said, "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) taught:

In the name of Allah, I seek refuge with the perfect words of Allah from His wrath, from His punishment, from the evil of His servants, from the whispers of Satan, and from the presence of Satan to me. (Narrated by Ahmad, Abu Daud, and at-Tirmidzi)
text.98:

text.99:
In this verse, Allah informs us about the words spoken by the disbelievers when facing death, even though these words cannot be heard by those present at that time. The disbeliever asks Allah not to let him die yet and to allow him to live as before so that he can repent from his mistakes and disobedience and can believe and do good deeds that he did not do during his life.

Such is the state of the disbelievers when they are still healthy and capable of believing and doing good deeds; they refuse to accept the truth, are arrogant and haughty towards those who believe, are always disobedient to Allah, even committing actions that contradict Allah's commands and uttering untrue words about Him. However, when in the throes of death (sakaratul maut), they remember the sins and mistakes they have committed. At that moment, they become aware and conscious and then sincerely ask Allah to grant them a long life to do good in order to cover up all the disobedience and evil they have done. Nevertheless, the time of sakaratul maut is not the time to ask for forgiveness and repent, as stated in His word:

And repentance is not accepted of those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "Indeed, I have repented now," or of those who die while they are disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment. (an-Nisa'/4: 17-18)

Then Allah affirms that the request of the disbelievers is only a statement that comes out of their mouths and will not be granted. Even if they were truly given a long life, they would still not return to faith and would not want to do good deeds, as Allah affirms in His word:

If you could but see when they will be standing before the Fire and will say, "Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers." Rather, what they had concealed before has [now] become evident to them. But even if they were returned [to life], they would surely revert to that which they were forbidden. And indeed, they are liars. (al-An'am/6: 27-28)

Thus, the words they utter are only to comfort their own hearts, words that have no value at all because it is impossible for them to live again because their time has come. Before them lies a barrier that prevents them from returning to the world until the Day of Resurrection.

Conclusion
